main event: An unidentified object was observed in the sky in Ottawa, Illinois on August 17, 1965.
interesting points: The object was observed for a total of 15 seconds,It had a horizontal flight path from SE to NW and disappeared beyond trees,It was brighter than the North Star and covered the width of a thumb at arm's length in 1 second,The observation was evaluated and concluded to be a satellite, not a meteor as initially suggested,Two witnesses reported seeing a figure described as approximately 6 ft. tall, grey in color, floating a few feet above the ground.
witness description: two adult males described as having seen a grey floating figure and other witnesses observing a circular metallic object.
